thread.title: La Grande too much for visiting Pioneers in 56-3 GOL victory
thread.title_full: La Grande too much for visiting Pioneers in 56-3 GOL victory

title: La Grande too much for visiting Pioneers in 56-3 GOL victory
text: Print this article Advertisement LA GRANDE — La Grande put 32 first-quarter points on the board here Friday against McLoughlin High in the Greater Oregon League opener for both schools. The Pioneers never recovered as the Tigers went on to post a 56-3 win. “We have started off slow in five of our six games,” Pioneers coach Doug South said. “We get in a hole early.” La Grande added six points in the second period and went to intermission in control with a 38-0 lead. Mac-Hi battled to avoid the shutout, and came through in the fourth quarter. Danny Flores split the uprights with a 39-yard field goal to get the Pioneers on the board. “When I was hired, there were some excitement about changing the football program into a winner,” South said. “It has been a tough year with injuries and playing The Dalles and Crook County with an inexperienced team in the preseason. I share the disappointment of our community. “I am hoping that next year, when we are looking at our preseason schedule, we can make some changes,” South continued. “It may take some help at the state level, but it is important for the safety of our kids. It is a difficult conversation that needs to be had.” The Pioneers host winless Ontario on Friday in a GOL battle. “I am not alright with losing,” Short said. “As a team, we are doing everything we can to be successful.” La Grande 56, McLoughlin 3 Mac-Hi 0 0 0 3 — 3 La Grande 32 6 6 12 — 56 No further statistics were available.
